FuncDef:
The ip pool-group command creates an address pool group and displays the address pool group view if the address pool group exists.
The undo ip pool-group command deletes an address pool group.
By default, no address pool group is created.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an address pool group. It can contain the following characters:
Letters A-Z, or a-z.Digits 0-9..- or _.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-insensitive characters.

Indicates an IP address pool group for access users.
-

Examples: Info:It's successful to create an IP address pool group.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An address pool group is a set of address pools sharing specified attributes. Configuring an address pool group avoids duplicate configurations. An address pool group can be created in either of the following situations:
Multiple domains share some address pools.A RADIUS server is able to deliver address pool names.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
